title: Python
summary: The document provides an overview of Python development for the Ergo blockchain. It discusses the available libraries and bindings, notably the Python bindings for sigma-rust, which enable core blockchain interaction capabilities. The document also highlights two Python frameworks: ergpy, a python-jvm wrapper for interacting with the Ergo blockchain, and Appkit, which can be used from Python. Additionally, the document mentions ErgoPad, a project that has released a set of Docker containers for a React/MaterialUI frontend, REST API backend, assembler to interact with smart contracts, and supporting services like ergonode, Redis, and PostgreSQL. The document also provides links to specific ErgoPad features like NFT-Locked Vesting and the ergo-python-appkit repository.

qa_pairs.answer: ErgoPad has released a set of docker containers combined to create a React/MaterialUI frontend, REST API backend, assembler to interact with smart contracts and supporting services like ergonode, redis and postgres.

qa_pairs.answer: Python developers can use the [Appkit](appkit.md) library to interact with the Ergo blockchain.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the ergpy library for Python developers?
qa_pairs.answer: The ergpy library is a python-jvm wrapper for interacting with the Ergo blockchain.

sections.heading: Python
sections.content: Python developers can interact with the Ergo blockchain using various [libraries](libraries.md) and [bindings](sigma-rust.md#bindings). Notably, [Python bindings for sigma-rust](sigma-rust.md#bindings) are available, providing core [blockchain interaction](interact.md) capabilities.
